text: For example, he said, he opposed rent control because “it doesn’t work,”
and told a throng of people who showed up at his doorstep he wouldn’t support defunding the police.
Frey touts the city as a national leader in providing affordable housing, creating 8.5 times more affordable homes than in the past.
He also points to the rebuilding of the police force after a wave of resignations and retirements in the wake of Floyd’s murder by police.
He also points to another change, creation of a new Office of Community Safety.
President Donald Trump’s ban of DEI programs in the federal government.

text: President Trump has aggressively moved to abolish diversity and inclusion offices and programs across the U.S. government by leveraging federal money.

text: Trump has called for investigations into whether some schools with endowments over $1 billion are complying with his orders.

text: Spokesman Jake Ricker said the university is not rolling back diversity, equity and inclusion or making preemptive changes to existing programs.
“My commitment to supporting all of our students, faculty, and staff remains unchanged, as does the Law School’s mission of building a legal profession representative of the people it serves.”
